modules.description: Handles HTML template rendering with predefined layouts and site metadata. Operates on site configurations, posts, and pages represented as records. Used to generate static blog outputs with consistent styling and structure.

Provides functions to construct a theme handler using a specified base directory, and utilities to manipulate HTML elements by replacing children or text content. Works with OCaml's Soup library to modify DOM nodes and URI strings. Used to dynamically generate or alter web content based on Jekyll Minima theme templates.

Generates HTML fragments for headers, heads, footers, and social icons using URI and theme data. Operates on strings, URIs, lists of links and contacts, and theme configurations. Used to build structured web pages with consistent styling and navigation elements.

Provides functions to construct and render HTML elements for web pages, including default layouts, articles, and home pages. Works with types like Soup.node, Uri.t, Ptime.t, and custom page data structures. Used to generate structured HTML for blog posts, homepages, and metadata-rich pages with specific styling and navigation.
